title: Storm Center Update- Friday AM
text:
Storm Center Update- Friday AM October 9, 2015, 6:22 AM by Brian Karstens SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
After a frosty start to the morning in parts of northeastern KELOLAND, the big weather story will be a major warm-up for the weekend. 
We are tracking 30s this morning across part of the northeast, with a morning low of 28 as of 6am in Aberdeen. Huron and Mitchell have also dropped into the upper 30s. Frost advisories were issued as a result of the colder temperatures across parts of the James Valley. 
The forecast will remain cool today across the east with highs in the middle 60s in Sioux Falls. Pierre and Rapid City will be warmer in the middle 70s. 
Tonight will not be as cold with lows in the lower 50s under mostly clear skies and south winds at 5-15mph. 
We expect a big warm-up tomorrow with highs returning to the 80s in many areas. We could get close to 90 in both Pierre and Rapid City. Sioux Falls will be near 80 with gusty southwest winds. 
Sunday will be another warm day with more 80s likely, well above normal for this time of year. 
Monday will be cooler as winds turn around to the northwest at 15-30 mph. Temperatures will also cool back into the 60s in many areas. 
It still looks mild Tuesday and Wednesday, but a bigger change in the jet stream may allow colder weather to spill into the northern plains just after the 7-day forecast.
